title: Kremlin Critic Alexei Navalny Convicted of Extremism and Sentenced to 19 Years in Prison
description: Opposition leader Alexei Navalny is already serving a 9-year term on a variety of charges that he says were politically motivated.

title: Dreamin’ Wild Tells the Moving True Story of a Teenage Rock Dream Fulfilled
description: The new movie tells the story of Donnie and Joe Emerson—who, as kids in 1979, made a wonderful album that almost nobody heard until decades later.

title: Trump Rivals Take Their Vows to Shrink Government Into Darker Territory
description: A voter asked Ramaswamy if he would fire "everybody in the government" involved with Trump's "persecution."

title: Influencers Are Struggling to Find Their Role in the SAG-AFTRA Strike—And Beyond
description: As influencers who work adjacent to Hollywood stop their work in support of the strike, many are weighing their futures.

title: What to Do If You Catch COVID-19 This Summer
description: Now that the COVID-19 public health emergency is over, here's what to do if you test positive for COVID-19 in the summer of  2023.

title: The Limits of the U.S.-Saudi Relationship
description: The U.S. and Saudi Arabia have come to need each other less

title: The Storied History Behind the Lakers-Celtics Rivalry in Winning Time Season 2
description: The second season of the HBO docudrama delves into one of the most storied sports rivalries of all time, led by Larry Bird and Magic Johnson.

title: Ira Sachs’ Lustrous Romantic Drama Passages Tackles a Tricky Love Triangle
description: This is a smart, lustrous film, and a bracingly honest one, the kind of movie that leaves you feeling both invigorated and a little blue.

title: How Heartstopper Helped Young Fans Around the World Come to Terms With Their Sexuality
description: From Brazil to Hungary to France, 'Heartstopper' is connecting with queer young people—and helping them tell their own stories.

title: Infants Should Get The Recently Approved RSV Vaccine This Fall, Health Officials Say
description: U.S. health officials recommend that babies should get the recently approved RSV vaccine this fall, ahead of the virus's season in the winter.

title: 7 Ways to Bring a Dead Friendship Back to Life
description: Positivity, consistency, and vulnerability play a key role.

title: A Greek Zoo Is Serving up Frozen Meals to Animals to Help Them Beat Extreme Heat
description: The Attica Zoological Park hopes it will help combat extreme heat that has plagued Greece this summer.

title: Barbie Will Be Released in the UAE, After a Month of Unexplained Delays
description: The movie’s inclusion of a transgender actress could be an issue in Arab countries with Muslim majorities.

title: Andrew Tate Released From House Arrest While Pending Human Trafficking and Rape Trial
description: The divisive internet influencer who is charged in Romania with rape, human trafficking and forming a criminal gang to sexually exploit women, won an appeal on Friday to be released from house arrest.

title: I’m a Screenwriter. These AI Jokes Give Me Nightmares
description: Sure, ChatGPT sucks at writing jokes, but I've tried secret AI programs and they're no joke for writers like me.

title: India’s Top Court Suspends Rahul Gandhi’s Defamation Conviction, Clearing His Way to Re-enter Politics
description: The Supreme Court's decision allows the opposition leader to re-enter Parliament and contest the next general election.

title: As Singapore Hangs More Drug Offenders, Some Worry Cases Aren’t Always Clear-Cut
description: Critics have questioned the fairness of prosecutors’ and judges’ broad discretion as well as the court’s presumptions against defendants during trial.

title: Two Expelled Black Tennessee House Democrats Officially Win Back Their Seats
description: Tennessee State Reps. Justin Jones and Justin Pearson officially won reelection after being expelled for a gun violence protest.
